name: places/ChIJV5171IpYwokRq-L5LJMzYYo
formattedAddress: 74 W 68th St #1C, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 74 W 68th St #1C, New York, NY 10023-6049, USA

originalText.text: I've been playing violin since I was very young. I grew up in the Midwest and my parents and I would travel to this studio for all my violin needs throughout my childhood. Every violin I've played in my memory is from this shop (that's like 20+ years of memories!) and every visit to this shop is a beloved and cherished memory. If you have kids that are serious about playing, the owners of this shop are the most informative and welcoming people and this experience will make a lasting impression on a young musician! Now I'm an adult and I recently moved to NYC and remembered this spot... had to leave a review. Still play my violin and bow from them (bought in 2010/2011) and it plays beautifully, always has. So much love for this shop!

originalText.text:
I first went to David Segal's shop last Monday where I tried out bows for nearly two hours. It was a lot of fun--I had never played on so many bows so it really blew my mind how different my violin sounded from bow to bow. I left with two bows to try at home for the week, going back earlier today to purchase one.

I couldn't have been more thrilled with my experience at David Segal Violins. Diane's mix of friendliness and top-tier expertise made it such a fun, interesting, and educational experience. I wasn't rushed or pressured, if anything, quite the opposite!

I have already recommended several people make appointments and will definitely be going back whenever I need anything. Make an appointment and go--you will not regret it!

I have already recommended several people make appointments and will definitely be going back whenever I need anything. Make an appointment and go--you will not regret it!

originalText.text: I bought my violin last summer, at that time I was really undecisive when choosing between two vintage violins, then Diane helped me pick a violin that suits me the best (and actually the cheaper one). Now after a few months, I'm in love with the violin I bought, and my techniques have improved quite a lot since then. I'm so happy I made the right choice! I will definitely come back when I want to upgrade my bow.

originalText.text: My 8 year old needed to size up her violin, and my 5 year old was getting her first one.  Finn (the person who helped my girls select their violin) was so ridiculously patient.  He took his time with each girl, let them play the instruments, touch the bows, play with the bows, until they found the perfect fit.  The violins sounded beautiful, and this experience made it so exciting for my 5 year old who is a beginner.  All in all, it wasn't just buying a violin, it was an experience of a life time that will hopefully stay with my daughters. Finn also let my daughters tour the repair shop, where they saw all different types of string instruments in various stages of repair.  They adored it.

originalText.text: I had an amazing experience at David Segal purchasing my violin. I had gone to other luthiers in the area and I can say with full confidence that none compare to the level of honesty and expertise. Finn and Diane made me feel comfortable and at-home with my violin journey and I am confident I found the best possible violin in my price range. If you have any violin needs, go see Finn and Diane right away!
